1121760694242828295.text: I just published some pretty big news about what ahead for web font delivery and performance. I think you should read about it: https://rwt.io/typography-tips/progressive-font-enrichment-reinventing-web-font-performance … #RWD #WebPerformance #WebTypography

1106303917455896576.text: After a long wait and a great effort by @marcusklaas and others, pulldown-cmark 0.3.0 is released! Read about it at https://fullyfaithful.eu/pulldown-cmark/

1107654782544736261.text:
Bit-level optimization quiz time again. What does this do?

a & !(((a + 0x1f1f1f1f) & !(a + 0x05050505) & 0x80808080) >> 2)

Note: In Rust, ! is bitwise not, in C this would be ~ but otherwise the same.

1121802865805123585.text: I'm doing a research retreat next week to explore implementing 2D graphics in GPU compute. An early preview of that work is https://github.com/pcwalton/pathfinder/pull/137 …. Wish me luck!

1121075722863300610.text: Thanks to the great work by @marcusklaas we just released pulldown-cmark 0.5. This bumps to the CommonMark 0.29 spec and has impressive speedups - not sure if we're the fastest parser, but certainly in the running.

1110570841920565248.text: Libre Graphics Meeting schedule is up, May 29 to June 2, and with presentations on splines and Rust 2D graphics. See you there! https://libregraphicsmeeting.org/2019/

1115629882476654592.text: I'm doing perfect hashing for Unicode lookups. Perfect hashing only requires "Good Enough" hash functions. Does anybody know really fast u32->u32 hash-like functions? So far I've got (x * a) ^ (x * b), which seems pretty good.

1101242199822327808.text: I'm looking to set up an LLC for my work (mostly around the potential new font editor). What name do people prefer?

1115783242622296064.text: For the curious, I didn't find anything better than what I first posted, and the results are inhttps://github.com/unicode-rs/unicode-normalization/pull/37 …

1121916254288146432.text: Wrapping up my contract on low-level Rust text layout work, here's my progress report:https://raphlinus.github.io/rust/skribo/text/2019/04/26/skribo-progress.html …

1104158154567217152.text: Draft of skribo (low level text layout) requirements: https://github.com/linebender/skribo/pull/2 … . If you think you will be using text layout in your Rust code, feel free to comment!

1100889936322912256.text: Announcing the start of skribo, a new Rust crate to implement low level text formatting:https://raphlinus.github.io/rust/skribo/text/2019/02/27/text-layout-kickoff.html …

1107876969872408577.text: On the topic of neural approaches to kerning, @machinaut and I brainstormed the other day a radical, first-principles approach: space type to maximize the success rate of a (NN) recognizer under degraded conditions. No idea whether it will work, but might be worth a try.

1102586771970220033.text: To get my new Linebender LLC off the ground, it would be useful to have a small invoiced consulting gig. If there's something you could use, please get in touch.
